Absolutly beautiful. The game was fun and chalenging the whole way though. When ever the situation is starting to get boreing the game switches things up and genuinly suprises you with plot twists. There is not a single negative thing i can say. This game is perfectly what it was designed to be. I highly recomend playing it. Dont expect to get more then 12 or 13 hours from the main game though.
The only thing that is bad about this gameâ€” is that I wish that there was a 3rd
DIVFERTIDO

I thoroughly enjoyed this game. It had a great story that kept you on your toes. The puzzles were just the right difficulty, adapting to your experience with the game, so that it was always hard enough to challenge you, but not easy enough so that it will require numerous play-throughs to memorize the solutions.
I recommend this game to anyone who likes a great puzzle game with a fantastic story and one of the best co-op experiences.

fedq

Wow. Just wow. This game is something else, for real. Puzzles, story, drama, laughs, cries, this game has it all. It really makes you feel clever after you complete a room you've been stuck on. It's very relaxing as well, sometimes therapeutic. And if you haven't finished it yet, keep playing, the ending is one of the best of any game. It leaves you smirking and almost giggling, then mind blown. :)

I played portal and portal 2 with no time inbetween. And i have to say that although the more advanced mechanics made playing levels more creative, I was let down by the quality of the story and character and ending of this game. I bought both games for under 2 dollars so I can't complain and definitely recommend. I was mostly let down because i felt there was so much more room of great storytelling here compared to the first Portal which was very limited. I gave Portal a 9.5/10 and I'm giving a Portal 2 a 7/10

TLDR: Obviously better mechanics than portal 2, story was lacking in comparison.
Just saying Caroline and everything will be very very bad.

Excellent Game. 

Played through end to end and enjoyed almost all the levels. Quirky sense of humour to the commentary, The somewhat bizarre plot line felt quite innovative to me; note that I haven't played the first Portal game. There was a gradual evolution of puzzles which came at a reasonably friendly pace, without being too repetitive. This made it overall a thoroughly enjoyable experience. 

Had a reasonably decent length as well. Would strongly recommend.

Ğ¢ÑƒÑ€Ñƒ-Ñ‚ÑƒÑ€Ñƒ-Ñ‚ÑƒÑ€Ñƒ Ñ‚ĞµÑ€Ğµ-Ñ‚ĞµÑ€Ğµ-Ñ‚ĞµÑ€Ğµ
Well here we are again.
It's always such a pleasure.
Remember when you tried
to kill me twice?
Oh how we laughed and laughed.
Except I wasn't laughing.
Under the circumstances
I've been shockingly nice.

You want your freedom?
take it.
That's what I'm counting on.

I used to want you dead
but
Now I only want you gone.

She was a lot like you.
(Maybe not quite as heavy).
Now little Caroline is in here too.
One day they woke me up -
So I could live forever.
It's such a shame the same

will never happen to you.

You've got your
short sad
life left.
That's what I'm counting on.
I'll let you get right to it -
Now I only want you gone.

Goodbye my only friend.
Oh, did you think I meant you?
That would be funny
if it weren't so sad.
Well you have been replaced.
I don't need anyone now.
When I delete you maybe
I'll stop feeling so bad.

Go make some new disaster.
That's what I'm counting on.
You're someone else's problem.

Now I only want you gone.
Now I only want you gone.
Now I only want you gone.
